sudo modprobe ath9k

wpa_supplicant must be managing if you're connected
So if I blank its config file it will work normally
did you setup wpa_supplicant , if so NM isn't needed , usually
melkor I set my network details when prompted by the ncurses alternate installer so that it could check mirrors, I never touched anything
melkor  the installed system gives be "configuring network interfaces" when my SSID is unavailale delaying boot but everything worked on its own
When I switch of the adapter then back on, it does not reconnect until reboot, also if I start the computer when the router is of I have to wait 30s extra on boot for timeout
